subject: Re: [junit] setup XMLUnit
msgSnippet: Hi James, Thanks for replying. This is an IDE problem - I m using JBuilder. I have added libraries for all those jar files. Are these two in seperate jars:
messageBody:
Hi James,

Thanks for replying. This is an IDE problem - I'm using JBuilder. I have added
libraries for all those jar files.

Are these two in seperate jars: assertXMLEqual() and assertXpathExists(),
because I only have problem with the latter? If yes, which jar file should I
add?

Thanks!

-Jing

--- James Abley <james.abley@...> wrote:

> On 17/10/05, chen_jingjing <chen_jingjing@...> wrote:
> >
> > Hi,
> >
> > I'm learning about XMLUnit. When I tried with the sample code from
> > http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/example.html, I can't get rid of the
> > following compile error:
> >
> > cannot find symbol; symbol : method assertXpathExists
> > (java.lang.String,java.lang.String), location: class
> > XMLFileExporterTest at line 47 (47:9)
> >
> > Among all the assert functions, I only have trouble with Xpath
> > related ones.
> >
> > When I tried to configure the parsers, I had "connot find symbol"
> > error for XMLUnit.setSAXParserFactory() and
> > XMLUnit.setTransformerFactory().
> >
> > I have included the following jars: xmlunit1.0, xalan, xml-apis,
> > serializer, xercesImpl.
> >
> > Any suggestions would be appreciated! If there's a FAQ for XMLUnit
> > somewhere, I'd be happy to check it out as well.
> >
> > Thanks.
> > -Jing
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > ------------------------------
> > YAHOO! GROUPS LINKS
> >
> >
> > - Visit your group "junit <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit>" on
> > the web.

junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com<junit-unsubscribe@yahoogroups.com?subject=Unsubscribe>

> >
> >
> > ------------------------------
> >
> Jing,
>
> It does sound like a classpath issue. Can you provide a command-line that
> you're using, or is this an IDE problem?
>
> James
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
